member.name: T:QuestWPF.FileImportCommand
member.summary: Command to open an Excel workbook to import data.

member.name: M:QuestWPF.FileImportCommand.Execute(System.Object)
member.summary: A method to execute the command. If the parameter is null, it opens a file dialog to select a file. If the parameter is a string, it treats it as a file path.

member.name: M:QuestWPF.FileImportCommand.OpenWorkbook(System.String)
member.summary: Opens an Excel workbook given its filename. First, it creates a WorkbookInfoVM instance and subscribes to its PropertyChanged event to monitor loading status. Before executing, it instructs CommandCenter to execute "AddFloatingView" command to add a floating view for the ExcelView. After that, it calls OpenSpreadsheetAsync on the ExcelView to load the selected spreadsheet asynchronously. When the WorkbookInfoVM's IsLoaded property changes, it notifies CommandCenter to update the CanExecute status of "StartImportCommand". ///

member.name: T:QuestWPF.FileOpenCommand
member.summary: Command to open a Quest project file.

member.name: M:QuestWPF.FileOpenCommand.Execute(System.Object)
member.summary: A method to execute the command. If the parameter is null, it opens a file dialog to select a file. If the parameter is a string, it treats it as a file path.

member.name: M:QuestWPF.FileOpenCommand.OpenQuestFile(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a Quest file given its filename. It uses the appropriate method of FileCommandHelper to read the file contents. Then, it creates a ProjectQualityVM from the ProjectQuality object and then opens a new QuestView window to display the project.

member.summary: Optional flag indicating whether the file is to be opened in read-only mode.

member.name: T:Quest.FilenameTools
member.summary: Static class providing filename related tools.

member.name: M:Quest.FilenameTools.MakeFilterString(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a file filter string suitable for use with file dialogs, based on the specified description and file extensions.
member.remarks: The returned string is intended for use with the Filter property of file dialogs such as OpenFileDialog or SaveFileDialog. Each extension should include the leading dot (e.g., ".txt").
member.param: The display name or description for the file type (for example, "Text Files").
An array of file extension strings (including the dot, such as ".txt") to include in the filter. Cannot be null or empty.
member.returns: A filter string in the format "Description (*.ext1;*.ext2)|*.ext1;*.ext2" that can be used with file dialog filters.
